content.question:
A certain statistic will be used as an unbiased estimator of a parameter. Let <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the sampling distribution of the estimator for samples of size 35, and let <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the sampling distribution of the estimator for samples of size 15.
Which of the following must be true about <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>Â ?

choices.label: The expected values of <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> will be equal, and the variability of <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> will be less than the variability of <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The expected values of <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> will be equal, and the variability of <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> will be equal to the variability of <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The expected values of <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> will be equal, and the variability of <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> will be greater than the variability of <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The expected value of <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> will be greater than the expected value of <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the variability of <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> will be greater than the variability of <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The expected value of <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> will be greater than the expected value of <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the variability of <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> will be less than the variability of <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The expected values of <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> will be equal, and the variability of <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> will be less than the variability of <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Determine parameters for probability distributions.
